result.execSummary:
The defendant GEORGE W CORREA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Judgment being placed against the Defendant for any outstanding amount.

with Good Time.  With HUBER if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  No HUBER for failure to report.    Defendant to report in PERSON to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentencing with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application in order to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Immediately following court, please report to:  Room 15 on the lower level of the Courthouse, 415 Jackson Street Oshkosh WI.  Collections are done Monday - Friday 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  You have 72 hours to make arrangements to complete collection.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. GEORGE W CORREA

records.addlTxt: 10:53 AM Prosecuting attorney David C. Rashid in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant GEORGE W CORREA in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court for GEORGE W CORREA. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.

08:48 AM Defendant GEORGE W CORREA in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 09:13 AM Defendant GEORGE W CORREA in court.  Stephanie Ann Stauber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for DAA and would like to get an attorney.  Court will appoint Attorney Ryan Ulrich.  Victim rights complied with.  Bond continues.  Adjourn.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:45 am.

You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7).  Contact (920) 236-4906 IMMEDIATELY after your hearing to schedule an appointment.  You must bring your court hearing paperwork to your appointment.  No contact with V1 (OPD 22-2861)

09:07 AM Defendant GEORGE W CORREA in court.  Nerrissa L Dyett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of and waives rights.  Copy of complaint received by Def.  Plea entered.  Bond set by Court.  Marcy's law complied with.  Adjudication/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
